abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission is seeking to extract a rare admission of wrongdoing from JPMorgan Chase. | SAC Capital Advisors agreed to keep most of its money in its fund while operating under a criminal indictment. | América Móvil offered to buy the stake in KPN it did not already own. | William A. Ackman urged J.C. Penney to speed up a search for a permanent chief.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission is seeking to extract a rare admission of wrongdoing from JPMorgan Chase. | SAC Capital Advisors agreed to keep most of its money in its fund while operating under a criminal indictment. | América Móvil offer...
lead_paragraph: S.E.C. SAID TO PRESS JPMORGAN FOR ADMISSION OF WRONGDOING  | The Securities and Exchange Commission is seeking to level civil charges against JPMorgan Chase and extract a rare admission of wrongdoing, as an investigation into last year’s multibillion-dollar trading loss enters its final stage, Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg report in DealBook. If JPMorgan concedes to some wrongdoing, such an admission would set an important precedent for the S.E.C., which for decades allowed defendants to “neither admit nor deny wrongdoing.” An agreement could come as soon as this fall, people briefed on the case said, adding that the agency had not threatened to charge JPMorgan executives.

headline.main: S.E.C.’s New Tack in JPMorgan Inquiry

abstract: Government authorities plan to arrest two former employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: Government authorities plan to arrest two former employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:30 p.m. | Government authorities are planning to arrest two former JPMorgan Chase employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss, a dramatic turn in a case that tarnished the reputation of the nation’s biggest bank and spotlighted the perils of Wall Street risk-taking.

headline.main: U.S. Said to Plan to Arrest Pair in Big Bank Loss
headline.print_headline: U.S. Said to Plan To Arrest Pair In Big Bank Loss

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
